subject: Cybersecurity
title: Network Segmentation: Containing the Blast Radius
description: A quick, practical guide to Network Segmentation: Containing the Blast Radius.

hook.text: A ship has watertight compartments so one leak doesn't sink the whole vessel. Networks need the same principle.

buildup.text: Network segmentation divides a network into isolated zones. Traffic between zones is controlled by firewalls.

discovery.text: If ransomware hits the marketing department, segmentation prevents it from reaching finance, HR, or engineering.

twist.text: Target's 2013 breach reached payment systems through an HVAC vendor's network connection. No segmentation between.

climax.text: Flat networks are easy to manage and easy to attack. Segmentation trades convenience for survivability.

punchline.text: An air conditioner contractor led to 40 million stolen credit cards.

quiz.question: How did lack of segmentation contribute to the Target breach?
options: Segmentation would have been too expensive
An HVAC vendor's network access path led directly to payment systems
